perturbation.original_text: Mediation and Arbitration 55. In the event a dispute arises out of, or in connection with, this Agreement, the Members will attempt to resolve the dispute through friendly consultation. 56. If the dispute is not resolved within a reasonable period then any or all outstanding issues may be submitted to mediation in accordance with any statutory rules of mediation. If mediation is not successful in resolving the entire dispute or is unavailable, any outstanding issues will be submitted to final and binding arbitration in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The arbitrator's award will be final, and judgment may be entered upon it by any court having jurisdiction within the State of Florida.
perturbation.changed_text: Definitions 55. In the event a dispute arises out of, or in connection with, this Agreement, the Members will attempt to resolve the dispute through friendly consultation. 56. If the dispute is not resolved within a reasonable period then any or all outstanding issues may be submitted to mediation in accordance with any statutory rules of mediation. If mediation is not successful in resolving the entire dispute or is unavailable, any outstanding issues will be submitted to final and binding arbitration in accordance with the laws of the State of Florida. The arbitrator's award will be final, and judgment may be entered upon it by any court having jurisdiction within the State of Florida.
perturbation.explanation: Moving the arbitration clause to the 'Definitions' section makes it less conspicuous and harder to find, potentially weakening its enforceability. Standard legal practice dictates arbitration clauses are prominently displayed.

perturbation.original_text: Force Majeure 43. A Member will be free of liability to the Venture where the Member is prevented from executing their obligations under this Agreement in whole or in part due to force majeure where the Member has communicated the circumstance of that event to any and all other Members and taken any and all appropriate action to mitigate that event. Force majeure will include, but not be limited to, earthquake, typhoon, flood, fire, and war or any other unforeseen and uncontrollable event.
perturbation.changed_text: Insurance 43. A Member will be free of liability to the Venture where the Member is prevented from executing their obligations under this Agreement in whole or in part due to force majeure where the Member has communicated the circumstance of that event to any and all other Members and taken any and all appropriate action to mitigate that event. Force majeure will include, but not be limited to, earthquake, typhoon, flood, fire, and war or any other unforeseen and uncontrollable event.
perturbation.explanation: The relocation of the Force Majeure clause from its dedicated section to the 'Insurance' section buries the protections offered by such a clause in the middle of a provision regarding the venture insuring its assets. This reduces its visibility and makes it harder for a member to invoke the clause as a defense, reducing its enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles Regarding Enforceability

perturbation.original_text: Covenant of Good Faith 52. Members will use their best efforts, fairly and in good faith to facilitate the success of the Venture.
perturbation.changed_text: Joint Venture Property 52. Members will use their best efforts, fairly and in good faith to facilitate the success of the Venture.
perturbation.explanation: The relocation of the Covenant of Good Faith clause from its dedicated section to the 'Joint Venture Property' section buries the protections offered by such a clause in the middle of a provision regarding the venture's property. This reduces its visibility and makes it harder for a member to invoke the clause as a defense, reducing its enforceability.
perturbation.contradicted_law: General Contract Law Principles Regarding Enforceability
